question.body:
I'm working on an Android layout where I have a ViewPager2 and RecyclerView nested inside a NestedScrollView. I've encountered an issue when trying to call a function during scrolling: the scrolling stops, and I need to release my touch to continue scrolling. This disrupts the user experience, as the RecyclerView doesn't smoothly continue its scrolling.

Here's the code snippet I currently have:

vscroll1.setOnScrollChangeListener(new NestedScrollView.OnScrollChangeListener() {
    @Override
    public void onScrollChange(NestedScrollView v, int scrollX, int scrollY, int oldScrollX, int oldScrollY) {
        int stickyHeaderTop = linear_head.getTop();
        FaFragmentAdapter adapter = (FaFragmentAdapter) viewpager1.getAdapter();
        Fragment currentFragment = adapter.getFragment(viewpager1.getCurrentItem());
        RecyclerView recyclerView = currentFragment.getView().findViewById(R.id.recyclerview1);
        if (scrollY >= stickyHeaderTop) {
            recyclerView.setLayoutFrozen(false); // Unfreeze RecyclerView when scrolled past header
        } else {
            recyclerView.setLayoutFrozen(true); // Freeze RecyclerView before header
        }
    }

});

Issue:

When scrolling, the RecyclerView within the current fragment of the ViewPager2 stops scrolling as soon as my function is called: recyclerView.setLayoutFrozen(). To continue scrolling, I need to release my touch and start scrolling again.

Questions:

  1. How can I maintain smooth scrolling in the RecyclerView within ViewPager2 while calling functions during the scroll?

I use ChatGPT to make my question understandable, and the code is provided by ChatGPT. I'm new to Android.

What I've tried:

Using setLayoutFrozen() to control the scroll state of RecyclerView and pass the scrolling to recyclerview after scrollview reached bottom.
